title: Magnetism - Change in flux after rotation

content.description: A circular loop is placed in a magnetic field of unknown orientation. The initial magnetic flux through the loop is nonzero. The loop is then rotated <math alttext="180 degrees" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mn>180</mn> <mo>∘</mo> </msup> </math> about an axis in the plane of the loop and through the loop’s center.
content.question:
Which of the following correctly compares the magnitude and sign of the magnetic flux after the loop has been rotated to those of the original flux?

Magnitude of flux
 Sign of flux

A
 The same
 The same

B
 The same
 Opposite sign

C
 Less
 The same

D
 Less
 Opposite sign

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
